newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Irish bonds little changed in thin, aimless trade.
newsitem.headline: Irish bonds little changed in thin, aimless trade.

text.p: Irish bonds gave up modest early gains to finish hardly changed in very thin volumes in an abbreviated trading session on Tuesday, dealers said.
"Volumes have been very low and it was really just an aimless day," one dealer said. "There was nobody around to trade."

But dealers said the market would spring back to life after the New Year holiday, with Thursday's November credit growth statistics and Friday's release of the government's 1996 borrowing requirement providing a focus for domestic bonds.
By 1240 GMT the 6.5 percent bond due 2001 was five pence weaker at 101.65, to yield 6.00 percent, while the eight percent bond due 2006 was unchanged at 109.08, yielding 6.58 percent.
